Description: Pale apple-green or blue glazed composition scarab: engraved on the base with a group of hieroglyphic signs: 'nb' (inverted), 'mn', 'nb', rʿ'. Hole pierced through longitudinally. Abrasion or deposit on base .
Curator's comments: Hall, 'Catalogue' p. 226, 2253: the British Museum Excavation at Hala Sultan Tekke, Cyprus, revealed a plaque having on one side the inscription 'mn tʒwy nb', "Firm is the Lord of the double country" on a plaque which has the name of Ramses II on the other side. This seems to be the prototype for this sort of meaningless inscription and should also date the group. See P. Åströms et. al, 'Hala Sultan Tekke' I, p. 34 PI. XXI "f" (98-12-1-201).
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.182, no.19)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (p.226, 2253)
Condition: Fair / poor; abrasion and deposit on base.
